page.title: 09Wellesley Park School
page.content: Wellesley Park Primary School is the most modern building of the three primary schools in Wellington.It was completed in 1976.The catchment area of the school is mainly from the fairly new Barn Meads housing estate but a number of children come from the Wellesley Park side of the school and from the estate just of Pylesthorne Road. There at present 300 children on role rangeing from 4_11.There are eleven staff Mr M.J.Knight(Headmaster) Mr E.Harvey(Deputy head).Mr R.Martin, Mr N.Bright,Mrs E.Thomas,Mrs B.Cooper, Mrs M.Howard,Mrs E.Carpenter, Mrs M.Thomas,Miss S.Bush and Mrs G.Kilby.The secretary is Mrs B.Dunford.There are is also a school caretaker Mrs D.Bailey and three helpers Mrs Bowen, Mrs J.HUNT and Mrs P.Batten.
